item.title: Getting started with the Web
item.description: Naming name folders and files completely in lowercase with no spaces. This is because: Many computers, particularly web servers, are case-sensitive. Browsers, web servers, and programming languages do not handle spaces consistently. It’s better to separate words with dashes, rather than underscores: my-file.html vs. my_file.html. The short answer is that you should use a hyphen for your file names. The Google search engine treats a hyphen as a word separator but does not regard an underscore that way.
